results.description:
With The Best is offering you a 50% discount for a full weekend online tech conference for developers featuring the world’s top IoT technology experts, amazing startups, labs, and hard core devs. Confirmed speakers include Sandy Carter, VP of Amazon Web Services, Andrew Psaltis, Solutions Architect at Hortonworks, Tamara Dull, Director of Emerging tech at The SAS Institute, and Ashok Banerjee, CTO of Symantec.


Live tech talks from each speaker, followed by Q&As for you to dig a bit deeper, and book a private 1-to-1 session to have your own time with an IoT expert! Share and boost your own skills with other ‘Things’ gurus and enthusiasts around the world.


Not available for the whole conference? No worries! You’ll have access to all the talks after the event.


Don’t miss out - purchase your tickets today for $30 instead of the standard rate of $60 using code IOTCOLORADO50

http://iot.withthebest.com/#presentation
results.name: IoT With the Best

results.description:
Interested in an in-demand career with salaries up to six-figures? The job market for Salesforce professionals is growing, with over 300,000 job openings for Salesforce skills created last year*. In this class, you'll get a crash course in building simple employee-facing business apps that run on both a web browser and a mobile device - without writing any code!

This is not a sales pitch. I’m a Salesforce professional, and I’m passionate about bringing diversity to the tech sector and helping women learn about powerful career options.

Whether you’re familiar with Salesforce from your work experience or are just looking for a career in a hot field, join us to learn about app-building on Salesforce.

This class runs from 9 am to 4:30 pm with 30 minutes for lunch, and time for lots of breaks!


WHAT YOU WILL LEAVE THIS CLASS WITH:

• What is Salesforce and what are the career opportunities for Salesforce Admins and Developers?
• App-building concepts including data modeling, user interfaces, business logic, reports, dashboards, and mobile.
• Hands-on and guided project building to build a sample app in one day.
• Introduction to Trailhead (https://developer.salesforce.com/trailhead/), a fun online learning platform for Salesforce.
• Resources for connecting with the Salesforce community (https://success.salesforce.com/).

PREPARING YOURSELF FOR THIS WORKSHOP:
• Trailhead (https://developer.salesforce.com/trailhead/), the fun free way to learn Salesforce
• Salesforce1 Mobile App (AppStore and Google Play)
• Students should be fairly familiar with using the web and mobile applications and Googling for answers to all of life’s questions. You do not need any prior Salesforce experience.


TECHNOLOGY REQUIREMENTS:

Please bring a laptop, not an iPad/tablet. The visual development tools only run on a modern browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari 9.x and 10.x on Mac OS X, Internet Explorer 11).


LOCATION:

Turing School of Software & Design
[masked]th St.
Suite 100
Denver, CO


TRANSIT OPTIONS:
Take the H, F or D light rail lines to the 18th & California stop.Take the free 16th Street Mall Ride or the Free MetroRide to the California Street stop.

HOSTED BY:

Turing School of Software and Design


QUESTIONS?
We're here to help! If you have additional questions or would like to talk further before signing up for an event, please contact Cara Jo Miller at [masked]


WHY CHARGE?
We charge a fair registration fee for workshops/classes for a few reasons. A portion of the fee goes to the instructor to thank them for volunteering their time. The rest of the fee goes back to the community to pay for scholarship and food/drink for this and future events.


SCHOLARSHIPS
We are offering scholarships on a limited basis for students with financial need. Please complete our scholarship application [http://gdiboulder.com/scholarship] if you are interested.


Get to know the GDI Boulder/Denver community — join us on Slack! [http://slack.gdiboulder.com]

Before RSVPing to this event, please make sure you have read and understood the Class Policies. [https://www.meetup.com/Girl-Develop-It-Boulder-Denver/pages/23402760/Class_Polices/]

RSVPs will close 24 hours (Friday 10/13 at 9am) before the start time.
results.name: Intro to App Building with Salesforce [DENVER]

results.description:
* Note: this is a ticketed event! See below links for more information.


Denver Maker Faire

Maker Faire is a gathering of fascinating, curious people who enjoy learning and who love sharing what they can do. From engineers to artists to scientists to crafters, Maker Faire is a venue for these "makers" to show hobbies, experiments, projects.

We call it the Greatest Show (& Tell) on Earth - a family-friendly showcase of invention, creativity, and resourcefulness.

Glimpse the future and get inspired!

https://denver.makerfaire.com/



SparkFun AVC

https://avc.sparkfun.com/
results.name: Denver Maker Faire / Sparkfun AVC :: Day 1

results.description:
Hello!

It's been a summer of travel for me (work) and I regret I haven't been able to schedule any Factory Tours lately. :( Fall/Winter is looking better as my work assignment is changing, so I hope to see many of you soon!

In the meantime, it's that time of year again for Maker Faire! This is the Big One! (no more of that 'mini' shenanigans) ! :)

If you're looking for some Maker Inspiration, check it out! Maker Faire Denver this year includes the 9th SparkFun AVC (Autonomous Vehicle Competition)!

Additional events include 3 Arenas of over 100 Combat Bots, and Fashion Hackers, a Steam Train, Quad Copters, 14 Makerspaces from around the state, and much much more....

https://denver.makerfaire.com for Tickets!


Hope you see you!

-Karen

results.description:
This is an informal, regularly occurring self-motivated study group. Bring your trainings, readings, or practice problems. The group is here to provide guidance, help you answer questions (if we can), offer moral support, and keep you focused on your data learning goals. Basically, come hang out with us at a cafe and work through some data problems!

A good resource for data learning is the following link, which evaluates many available data science courses available on the web:
https://medium.freecodecamp.com/every-single-machine-learning-course-on-the-internet-ranked-by-your-reviews-3c4a7b8026c0

Other great sources for learning are Udacity, Udemy, Big Data University, Coursera, etc. For this study group, we meet at a cafe, the Source, near Boxcar Coffee. As a reminder, if you plan to stay for longer than 30 minutes, you need to park in the parking garage (free) around back.

Meetup organizers have experience in data analysis, statistics, and data development.

Agenda:

10:30-11:00 Getting to know each other & networking

11:00-12:00 Self-motivated study group. Feel free to use the networking time to gather with folks working on similar projects for the study group portion of the event (i.e., folks working in Python may want to group together while folks working in other programs may want to group together). The idea here is to keep you focused on your data learning and to create an environment where you can learn from other folks within the data industry.

Hope to see you all there!
results.name: Denver Data Study Group

results.description:
Description

Most modern Web APIs use JSON because of its interoperability and widespread use. All modern languages have excellent JSON support, but large, complex data sets often require more functionality than simple serialization/de-serialization. This presentation shows how to leverage JSON Search and Transform techniques and utilities to simplify working with large JSON data sets returned from Web APIs.

Abstract

Sometimes API Consumers need additional functionality when processing an API’s JSON response:

• Access a subset of the data.

• Filter results.

• Transform the JSON data to another format.


Many developers are familiar with serializing/de-serializing JSON data, but end up writing tons of custom code to do more advanced processing. There are excellent JSON Search (e.g., jq) and Transform (e.g., Handlebars, Mustache) utilities that enable Architects and Developers to improve their designs and drastically reduce the amount of effort needed to work with large and/or complex JSON documents.

This talk covers JSON Search and Transform:

• JSON Search makes your job easier:

• How to search JSON documents with jq, including:

• Online Testers

• Command Line

• Application Code

• How to write unit tests that search the content of JSON documents returned by a web API.

• Use JSON Transform to:

• Convert JSON to HTML.

• Convert a JSON document to a new (JSON) structure.

• Convert JSON with Online Testers and command line tools.

• Write unit tests that transform the content of JSON documents returned by a Web API.

This session will show practical JSON-based workflows, and provide techniques to search and transform JSON documents.

Example code will leverage jq, Handlebars, Mustache, JavaScript, and Node.js.

Tom Marrs is passionate about demonstrating the business value of technology. As an Enterprise Architect at TEKsystems Global Services, he leverages the enabling architectures and technologies that fuel the growing API Economy – REST, Microservices, and JSON. Tom has led enterprise-class API, Web, Mobile, Cloud, and SOA projects. An avid Agilist, Tom is a Certified Scrum Master and enjoys mentoring and coaching project teams.

Tom recently wrote JSON at Work for O’Reilly, and wrote the Core JSON Refcard on DZone (the #1 downloaded Refcard in 2013). In a past life, Tom co-authored JBoss at Work for O’Reilly. Tom has also been a speaker at the OSCON, No Fluff Just Stuff (NFJS) and Great Indian Developer Summit (GIDS) conferences. He hopes to speak again at these conferences in the near future.
results.name: Bitter JSON  (or When Complex Data Happens to Good Developers)

These sessions are a great opportunity to socialize with like-minded learners or get some help from a seasoned programmer.

Don't know where to start? We can help you get going with some great resources! Just ask when you come in.

results.description:
5:30-6:00: Pizza, Soda, Beer and Networking

6:00-6:15: Announcements

6:15-8:00: Let's Code!

8:00-8:15: Award ($50 Amazon gift card)

Goal

Have fun coding while improving and challenging your skills


The Challenge

Kill zombies to earn points and try to keep humans alive to maximize your score. The challenge takes place on a closed map. You control a Player, who can kill all zombies in a radius around him. (Full details will be revealed at the event).

Although the rules are extremely simple, you can come up with an incredible amount of improvements for your score.


Rules

• The challenge may be solved using any popular programming language (JavaScript, Python, Ruby, Go, Kotlin, Swift and more!)

• NO frameworks or external libraries allow

• You don't have to show your code, but you are required to share your ideas/approaches with everyone else


Hints

Here are some resources that may help you on the challenge.

• Decision tree

• Centroid

• Monte Carlo algorithm
results.name: Zombie Code Challenge

results.description:
At least two people came to me after our Masterminding session and told me that I MUST HAVE Annie Murlowski (of Rocky Mountain Bliss) speak at a future event. Little did they know that I had already been in talks with the talented Annie about doing just that.


Annie is a SEO superstar and promises to share her basic and high-level SEO tips with our group. No matter where you are in your SEO journey, she is going to give you a nugget of information you can take home and implement in your blog. These are going to be real-life, practical, anyone-can-do kinda tips that will set your blog on SEO fire!

I personally know that some of the SEO strategies I've learned over the years have changed my blog for the better. I'm benefiting from those strategies today and can't wait to hear more things from an expert such as Annie.

And guess what? We have a freaking amazing venue as our sponsor!!

Yep, we're visiting Ophelia's - an upscale gastropub with boudoir-style decor and the third concept restaurant from the owner of Linger and Root Down. Ophelia's promises to be an exciting place for us to meetup!

A few things about this event:

1. Annie is going to speak first at 5:30 pm, so PLEASE don't be late. Leave yourself plenty of time to get there - traffic will be a bear but this will be SOOO worth it! Food and a talk from Ophelia's will follow Annie at around 6:30pm.

2. Starting at 8:00 pm (if you want to stay late), it's open mic night at Ophelia's. I plan to stay for a bit to see what it's all about. Here's more info for Oct. 17's open mic night. (It's free to stay, but if you want to drink "adult" beverages at any time this night, you need to start your own tab.)

3. If anyone wants to ride with me from I-25 and Orchard, let me know! If you want/need to carpool from your location, please leave a comment here or on our Facebook page.

4. Parking is on the street surrounding the venue. There is no valet on Tuesday night.

5. Please bring a little something extra to tip our servers.

As always, our events are free for bloggers, but I do ask that you give our sponsor lots of social media love - you can start at anytime (even now). The more love you give, the easier it is for me to find awesome sponsors like Ophelia's to partner with.

Ophelia's on Facebook

Ophelia's on Twitter

Ophelia's on Instagram

Our event is limited to 30 bloggers. Please RSVP if you have every intention of showing up. I know last minute things happen that might cause you to cancel, but please take your RSVP serious because I do. :-)

Also, please please please make sure you're getting notifications from Meetup - this way if you're on the waitlist - you will be notified if your RSVP changes to "yes".

Thanks all - looking forward to another exciting event with my blogger friends!
results.name: Get Your SEO Rocking with Annie

venue.name: State of Colorado Governor's Office of Information Technology

results.description:
Speaker - Deborah Blyth, CISSP, CISM

Chief Information Security Officer

State of Colorado, Governor's Office of Information Technology

In August 2014, Deborah Blyth became the state’s new Chief Information Security Officer (CISO), bringing a diverse 25-year technology background including 14 years of information security experience. As the CISO, she serves as the point of contact for all information security initiatives in Colorado, informing the Secretary of Technology & Chief Information Officer and executive agency leadership on security risks and impacts of policy and management decisions on IT-related initiatives. Deborah is responsible for determining the strategic and tactical security direction for the State to meet established objectives.

Before joining the state of Colorado, Deborah led the Information Technology Security and Compliance programs at TeleTech (5 years) and Travelport (3 years). Deborah is a Colorado native and graduated Summa Cum Laude with a Bachelor of Science degree from Regis University.

Topic - Securing Colorado: How Colorado's cloud-first strategy is improving security and compliance

Parking / Transportation: Street Parking (no meters - YAY!!)

Need CPE's? Get them here!!!


After Meeting Networking / Drinks & Food:

Cheers!

CSA-CO Board

results.description:
Come downtown for food, drink, talks, and socializing. We'll be talking about ReactJS and related technologies. There is a lightrail stop at the corner of where the meetup is.

Talks/topics to be covered:

How Browsers Get Data by Chandler Prall


As web developers it is important to understand what our browsers do behind the scenes to communicate with and get data from servers. What does devtools mean by "DNS lookup", "initial connection", or "Waiting (TTFB)", and why is this important to me? This is a deep dive into internet connections and the dangerous journey all data takes as it moves to and from users, from the network layer in your operating system all the way to the browser's enforcement of Cross Origin Resource Security (CORS, aka the devil).

An Offline-Only Website: Lessons Learned by Chris Bolin

How to (and how to not) make offline React apps, publish an open source library, deal with fleeting viral fame, cope with trolls, translate into multiple languages, and promote your work. We’ll walk through a weird project I made and what it taught me.
results.name: Browsers Behind the Scenes and Offline Only Websites

results.description:
Come learn Haskell with us!

We will be working through "Haskell Programming from first principles" at a pace of one chapter per week (we can alter the pace if we want to). We'll read the chapter beforehand, discuss it online using the Denver Devs slack channel #topic-bookclub, and meet up here to go over the exercises and talk about it.

We'll be covering Chapter 9: "Lists"

The schedule of the meetup is:

6:00 - 6:15 - Meet, greet, socialize, acquire coffee, etc.
6:15 - 7:30 - Review of chapter exercises and discussion of the material

We will cover one chapter per week. The book is available here: http://haskellbook.com/ If you are a student or otherwise find the cost of the book prohibitively expensive, then contact the authors, and they'll provide a discount.

Sign up to denver-devs here: http://denverdevs.org

We will be adhering to the learnhaskell code of conduct found here: https://github.com/bitemyapp/learnhaskell/blob/master/coc.md

You can report any misconducts to Matt Parsons, J Haigh, or at this link: https://goo.gl/forms/eTT8qb5ZrNriUy2j1

We are committed to keeping this environment welcoming for all people learning Haskell!
results.name: Haskell Book Club

venue.name: Denver Corporate Center 1st Floor Conference Room

results.description:
Ryan Ciecalone is a Developer who is passionate about Full Stack JavaScript Web Development. He works at Polaris Alpha in Colorado Springs. Connect with him on Twitter @RyanCiecalone.

Angular Next - Getting started with the newest version of Angular.

Javascript has changed a lot since it was first released. Now it’s well on its way to becoming a first class language. With technology changing quickly and the need make sure browsers can keep up, where can you turn to keep things in order? You can turn to Angular. We’ll talk about the benefits that the new Angular framework provides. We’ll look at typescript, classes, and observables. We'll look code samples and show you how to hit the ground running with the amazing Angular CLI. We’ll discuss why an Angular Hello World app takes a good deal of code to get running and explain why it’s all important. You'll leave this talk with the basics needed to start your own Angular apps. Come on out and see what all of the buzz is about with Angular.
results.how_to_find_us: 7900 East Union Avenue, Denver, CO - First Floor Conference Room
results.name: Angular Next - Getting started with the newest version of Angular

results.description:
Come on everyone, let's work and learn!!


Theme for 2017: Software Development using Java!

As we have covered basic programming in Java, I thought we can go to the next level that is development of software. I don't have a particular project idea in my mind at the moment but we will start with any project which is already existing, to help the beginners and those who forgot about the development process.

There won't be any presentation which everyone listen and then go home, might return next time. This year, I will be working on a project and anyone can join me at anytime and we can discuss whats going on and can start themselves on the project or you can bring any other (java)project and can work or can get help on your already working project. This would be a discussion-working on projects group. If you are not working on any project or don't have an interest to do a project, Still you are welcome to meet interesting women and spend some time. You might get a spark to do something that you love!

Beginners who are not familiar with basics of java will be helped to start Java programming. All are welcome!

Helpful link to install Java


Recommended: Any IDE for coding in Java, like NetBeans, Eclipse, IntelliJ, Sublime, DrJava etc...

Our Format: This is a self-directed session where you can work through your latest project, tutorial, or book. Bring your current project and work on it, collaborate, or get some help! Here and there we will have members do small presentations on Java topics. This will be an inclusive work session where we can spend some time upgrading our own skills and helping each other build theirs.

Where: We are hosted at Denver tech-hub Galvanize, located at 1062 Delaware St, Denver CO(11th and Delaware). Signs will be posted at Galvanize!
results.name: (Denver) Java Study Group

results.description:
Presenter #1

Clark Hobbie, a Sr. level Software Developer will be doing a presentation on Miranda, an Open-Source system written in Java for creating reliable systems.

Clark has been doing Software Development for more than 20 years with over 10 years in Java specifically. For the last year Clark has been working on Miranda. Miranda is a new, open-source middle tier/back-end system for creating very reliable [masked]% uptime) systems. Miranda is available on GitHub at https://github.com/miranda-messaging/miranda

Additional info (including past presentations on Miranda) on Miranda is available at

https://miranda-messaging.com/

Presenter #2

"Integrating DevOps tools into the Software Value Stream"

Mara Puisite is an SE at Tasktop bringing with her years of industry and technical experience. Mara helps companies solve various bottlenecks in their software development and delivery process through the power of value stream integration, automation, and visibility.

IT Toolstacks keep growing and changing with ever more specialized tools that improve efficiency. Unfortunately, vital information becomes siloed and doesn't easily flow between these tools, causing poor coordination, mis-communication and lack of end-to-end visibility. Talking about how to discover the concept of value stream integration.
results.name: Miranda OSS followed by ValueStream Integration @ TaskTop

results.description:
You can’t run a business without Information Technology (“IT”), and most business owners take a traditional approach to IT because they don’t know their options. This session is for small and medium size business owners who need solutions and alternatives for secure and easy to use IT.

Whether you are not sure how your company PCs should be configured, unsure of where to start when setting up your website, anxious about data security and hacking threats or all the above, this training has you covered. When you leave this session, you will be armed with the knowledge to solve computer problems and the ability to save money by eliminating the traditional IT support model.

Businesses have an opportunity to recapture lost revenue and improve productivity by getting IT right. Trenegy, Goober LLC, and Evan Your IT Guy are teaching businesses how to eliminate the traditional IT support model and solve computer problems. Click here https://goo.gl/rW8uF1 to sign up for the August 9 Get IT Right overview track for small business owners.
results.name: Get IT Right Seminar at Denver Metro Chamber

group.name: Get IT Right for Small Businesses

results.description:
Doors: 5:00 p.m.
Pizza + Networking: 5:30 p.m.
Presentation: 6:00 p.m

The 4.3 release of Angular introduced a new HTTP client library and with it brought back a beloved feature from AngularJS - interceptors. Interceptors in the Angular teams own words "When your application makes a request, interceptors transform it before sending it to the server, and the interceptors can transform the response on its way back before your application sees it." In this talk, we will show you how to create HTTP Interceptors with Angular 4.3+, use cases for the interceptors - in our case and probably the most common case; authentication and authorization, as well as additional best practices and tips and tricks using the new HttpClient library.


Speaker Bio:
Ado Kukic @kukicado

Ado is a full-stack developer and developer evangelist at Auth0. Mixing his passion of programming and education, he creates tutorials, courses, and other educational content focusing on security, authentication, and much more. On the front-end, he prefers Angular, while on the backend he flip-flops between Node.js and Golang.
results.name: Angular HTTP Interceptors: There and back again

results.description:
Hi. So, who is an MVP? Colorado is very fortunate to have the quantity of, and quality of, Microsoft MVP awardees bopping around. And, for each MVP there are two or three alumni who have moved to other seasons in their career. Colorado is teeming with Microsoft MVP awardees.

Each MVP has a specialty: Client, Tooling, Cloud, and more. Each has a contribution area: SQL, C#, UWP, Azure, and more. And, each has demonstrated a deep passion for their own contributions back into their local, online, and regional developer communities. I would be that if you've ever met an MVP, you've likely met them at an event or heard them speak at meetups. Contributors identified as thought leaders and industry experts are recognized by Microsoft and renewed annual for their hard work, contribution and excellence.


If you are an MVP or an MVP alumni, this event is exclusively for you. A few times a year we get together for a meet-and-greet happy hour. This is your chance to talk shop, compare notes and rub elbows with other contributors like yourself. It's time for our Autumn Happy Hour. The calendar orchestration is over, and we landed on Wednesday, October 18th.

I am still working on the location, but I wanted to set this up so you could RSVP today and save the date in your calendar for this fun event. I will start with the restaurant we organized last time, but I haven't gotten to it yet.

See you there.
Jerry
results.name: Microsoft MVP Autumn Happy Hour

results.description:
"Digital Rights Management" by Erik Anderson


What is DRM?
How does it work on Android?
Can I protect my own content with DRM?

This meetup will cover the basics of DRM and provide a hands on exercise to answer your questions about digital rights management(DRM).

About Erik Anderson

Erik Anderson is a Denver native with over 20 years experience in software development. Over the last 5 years he has worked extensively with Android and for the last few years has led in the development of the android mobile app for Starz Entertainment. He loves the challenge of bringing out the best in the team while learning fun ways to solve interesting problems.

About the Droids

Each 3rd Wednesday of the month, we meet at POSSIBLE Mobile downtown. From 5:30-6pm we will socialize and enjoy food and drinks. At 6pm we will typically have a speaker giving a presentation about an interesting and informative Android development topic. If you are a new or experienced Android developer, or just someone that is curious about Android development, we hope you will join us and become a regular participant!
results.name: Digital Rights Management

results.description:
Event Description


The Learn to Code Learning Series is back and it's here to stay!

We’ve built an incredible curriculum, created resources, and made learning interactive. This learning series format combine breakout sessions, formalized instruction, and group learning to enable to grasp the skills necessary to become a web developer.

This event will occur on every Wednesday for the rest of 2017. It usually takes around 8 weeks to complete the entire curriculum. We have an on-boarding session at the beginning of every meeting so don't worry about falling behind!

If you can’t attend every meeting consecutively, that’s completely fine as well! The structure of this allows you to come and go as you please and enables anyone, of any skill level, to come and utilize resources for their skill level and needs.


If you’ve tried online tutorials just to get stuck and frustrated, this event is for you. We believe in community based learning to help anyone, of any skill level, grow their skills in web development.

The curriculum is geared towards someone who has never coded and will take you to foundational knowledge in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Learning to code can be incredibly intimidating, we built the learning series to be an approachable and encouraging introduction to web development for the most basic of beginners :)

Already have a little bit of coding knowledge? We have you covered! You’ll be able to breeze through the basics that you already mastered and join some breakout sessions that cover some more advanced topics.

By the end of the 8 part series you’ll be able to create and deploy a static website and create a mad-lib game completely from scratch.

Our first session will focus on the basics of a web page and teach you the basics of HTML and CSS.

**Make sure to Register on Eventbrite so we know how much food/drink to order!**

Schedule

6pm - Check in/Networking/Food/Drinks

6:20pm - Session Kick off. Intro Lecture

6:50pm - Breakout sessions

7:45pm - Return as group. Knowledge share. Q&A


What to bring

Your Computer -- Fully charged!

Computer Charger

Desire to learn :)


Please feel free to comment with any questions. See you soon!
results.name: Intro To HTML/CSS/JavaScript­: Free Learning Series. Beginners Welcome!

results.description:
Do you need help getting your blog started? What if you're already blogging, but need help getting off the ground? Are you just interested and want to learn more about blogging?

Sweet. Let's help each other become better writers -- and better at life.

For this meeting, we'll focus on our why. Why are we writing in the first place? Do we even need a blog?

From our why, we can make our writing much easier and more fulfilling.

Let's find our whys together!

Here's how the meeting will go:

-- Simple introductions

-- What is your own why?

-- Share other problems with writing, blogging, living the writing lifestyle, etc.

And that's it. I'm hoping we all learn something from the meeting -- including the leader (aka me)!

Let us know if you have any questions.
results.how_to_find_us: On Larimer Square, enter the building with the blue and white awning. We'll be situated in the back.
results.name: Support for Bloggers and Writers and Anyone Interested In Writing

results.description:
Please register via EventBrite.

The original link is: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/dama-rmc-q4-meeting-hitchcock-thoughts-on-data-management-tickets-37587017782


Join Us in Costume for our October 19th Meeting at the BLM Federal Center at 6th Avenue & Kipling Street

Please remember the Halloween theme, but keep the masks off until you get through the security gate!

Kent Graziano of DAMA-RMC Annual Sponsor Snowflake Computing will be presenting on the basics of Agile Data Warehousing using Data Vault Data Modeling. Donna Burbank of Global Data Strategy, Ltd., will be presenting on building an Agile Metadata Strategy to keep your metadata up to date and easily accessible.

Security Concerns. Please bring an official government-issued photo ID.

Everyone on the Denver Federal Center must bring a Drivers License or government-issued photo ID. No guns, knives, bombs, alcohol, marijuana or other things you wouldn't take on an airplane are allowed on the federal campus. Only service animals are allowed on the campus.

Agenda

1:00 PM – 1:15 PM Sign-in and Networking

1:15 PM – 1:30 PM President’s remarks and Announcements (Job & Position needs, local events, etc.)

1:30 PM – 2:30 PM First Speaker – Kent Graziano – Agile Data Warehousing

2:30 PM – 2:45 PM Break

2:45 PM – 3:00 PM CDMP - Discussion

3:00 PM – 4:00 PM Second Speakers – Donna Burbank – Building an Agile Metadata Strategy

4:00 PM – 4:15 PM Lighting Rounds

4:15 PM – 4:30 PM Gifts and Wrap-up


Program Description

We are excited to have two great presentations from internationally recognized speakers that have local roots. Somehow Kent got exiled to Houston, but Donna is still here (if Nederland, CO is here). Please join us for an exciting afternoon at the Federal Center.

Please remember that the October membership meeting has a Halloween theme. So try out your costume for us, and we will have candy and cookies.

First Speaker, Kent Graziano

Abstract: Agile Data Warehousing: It Should Not Be Scary

As we move more and more towards the need for everyone to do Agile Data Warehousing, we need a data modeling method that can be agile with us. Data Vault Data Modeling is an agile data modeling technique for designing highly flexible, scalable, and adaptable data structures for enterprise data warehouse repositories. It is a hybrid approach using the best of 3NF and dimensional modeling. It is not a replacement for star schema data marts (and should not be used as such). This approach has been used in projects around the world (Europe, Australia, USA) for over 10 years but is still not widely known or understood. The purpose of this presentation is to provide attendees with an introduction to the components of the Data Vault Data Model, what they are for and how to build them. The examples will give attendees the basics:

What the basic components of a DV model are

How to build, and design structures incrementally, without constant refactoring

Bio:

Kent Graziano is a Senior Technical Evangelist with Snowflake Computing and the author of The Data Warrior blog (http://kentgraziano.com). He is a Certified Data Vault Master (CDVP2), Oracle ACE Director, expert data modeler and architect with over 30 years of experience, including 25 years doing data warehousing with multiple architectures. Kent is an award winning speaker and author, who has written numerous articles, co-authored four books (available on Amazon.com), and has done hundreds of presentations, nationally and internationally. You can follow Kent on his blog and twitter @kentgraziano.

Second Speaker, Donna Burbank

Abstract: Building an Agile Metadata Strategy: It’s not as Scary as You Think

According to a recent DATAVERSITY survey, over 80% of respondents agreed that metadata is as or more important than ever before. Yet with the rapidly-changing technical landscape, many historic metadata strategies can seem archaic and out of date. With the rise new technologies and approaches such as Big Data, graph databases, agile development, and data lakes, it can seem a daunting task to manage metadata in this new environment. Luckily, metadata management technologies and approaches are rapidly innovating as well, and there are a vast array of solutions to help you with your metadata journey. Join Donna Burbank, past president & advisor of the DAMA Rocky Mountain Chapter, as she discusses modern approaches to metadata management.

Bio:

Donna Burbank is a recognized industry expert in information management with over 20 years of experience helping organizations enrich their business opportunities through data and information. She currently is the Managing Director of Global Data Strategy Ltd, where she assists organizations around the globe in driving value from their data. She has worked with dozens of Fortune 500 companies worldwide in the Americas, Europe, Asia, and Africa and speaks regularly at industry conferences. She has co-authored several books on data management and is a regular contributor to industry publications. She can be reached at [masked] and you can follow her on Twitter @donnaburbank. She is past president of the DAMA Rocky Mountain Chapter.
results.name: DAMA-RMC Q4 Meeting: Hitchcock Thoughts on Data Management

group.name: Data Management Association – Rocky Mountain Chapt. DAMA-RMC

results.description:
Join Microsoft and edGarage for an exploration of how mixed reality technologies are transforming the way we work, learn, and collaborate.

We will be discussing mixed reality and its impact in education, which includes immersing students more deeply and interactively in subjects, improving workforce collaboration, and bringing people together from all over the globe.

There will be discussion about how mixed reality brings the digital world to life and how these technologies are enabling students, teachers and the workforce to achieve more.

Don’t miss this opportunity to experience the latest in mixed reality technologies and explore how they are changing the world around us with Microsoft and edGarage!

We'll be providing free happy hour drinks and snacks.
results.name: Mixed Reality: How AR and VR are changing teaching, learning, and work

results.description:
Join us on October 19th for our first panel style WIT event. We'll hear from a few trailblazing women in their respected sectors as they discuss their stories and how they came to level the playing field. Come prepared with questions, business cards, and the mindset to join in on some candid discussion!


Moderator:

• Cathy Shim, Director of Business Operations, TEKsystems

Panelists:

• Christian AiChang- Sr. Director of Application Development, DaVita


• Courtney App- IT Manager: Infrastructure, FirstBank

• Deanna Towne-Director of IT, Colorado Governor's Office


• Maggie Massary-Director of EDW/BI & Business Apps, Children's Hospital Colorado

Agenda:
5:45-6:30 Attendee arrival and mingle (food and drinks will be provided by TEKsystems)
6:30 Raffle Drawing and Intro to Cathy Shim
6:30-7:15 Panelist Discussion moderated by Cathy Shim
7:15-7:45 Q&A with Panelists
7:45-8:00 Continued Mingling
---------------------------------------------------------------------
If you have any interest in speaking at future events, or have suggestions for someone who might be, please don’t hesitate to let us know!

Any questions or comments please reach out to Alicia Jessip: [masked]

We look forward to meeting you!

Room:

Conference room name is 'Wisdom' on the 7th floor

Parking:

Garage at Alpha Park- 1601 Wewatta St Denver, CO 80204
Cost: $5-9, card only

Panelist Details:

Cathy Shim-

Cathy Shim is a Director of Business Operations for TEKsystems, a global provider of IT staffing, talent manager and IT services, and manages the day-to-day operations of the Denver Tech Center office. Cathy started her career with TEKsystems 6 years ago in Toronto, Ontario as a Technical Recruiter. She has since taken on various roles within the organization such as Government Services Account Manager, Government Services Division lead and Sales Manager of the Edmonton, Alberta office. One year ago she moved to Denver to take on this exciting opportunity to lead the Denver Tech Center team. Cathy is passionate about continuous learning, taking on new challenges and creating opportunities for others. She is a foodie, aspiring world traveler and lover of all animals.


Christina AiChang-

Christina brings over 20 years of software development experience to the table. She is currently the Senior Director of Application Development for Physicians Applications and manages 17 engineers. Her team focuses on tech stacks including IBM Bluemix Paas, Apigee, Kafka, Springboot, Cloud CMS and Looker analytics. Her favorite thing about IT?- White boarding solutions. Least favorite-alignment across "religions".

Courtney App-

Courtney App is currently an IT Manager supporting Core Infrastructure at FirstBank. Her team is responsible for server administration, application performance, and identity and access management in addition to infrastructure automation and secure file transfers with other financial institutions. She began her IT career in 2000 after several years of job-hopping in retail sales, insurance, and manufacturing management positions. She has seen the positive impact women have in traditionally male-dominated work environments, and has personal experience of both holding herself back and pushing herself forward to advance her career. She is currently a student in CSU Global’s Online Master’s Program and participates in Agile Denver’s Kanban SIG. Her favorite thing about IT is the endless opportunities for learning and growth and her favorite thing about management is seeing people advance their technical skills and achieve their professional goals.


Deanna Towne-

Deanna Towne serves as the IT Director within the Governor's Office of Information Technology supporting both the Department of Health Care Policy and Financing and the Department of Human Services. She has worked withing OIT for over 4 years and has focused in vendor/contract management, privacy and security compliance, and strategic IT planning and deployment. Prior to working in IT, Deanna worked for several years in the homeland security discipline and led capabilities based planning, security and risk assessments, mass evacuation planning and mass prophylaxis planning and education.

Deanna holds a Master's in Business Administration, graduated from the Executive Leaders Program from the Center from Homeland Defense and Security at the Naval Post Graduate School and is a recently certified Associate and Specialist in Cloud Infrastructure and Services Planning from Dell EMC.

Maggie Massary-

Maggie Massary serves currently as a Director of Business Intelligence and Business Applications at Children’s Hospital Colorado. She has over 17 years of experience in Information Technology, including 12 years in Healthcare. The last 10 years she spent leading and launching Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing departments and strategic initiatives related to Business Intelligence & Analytics, Enterprise Data Warehouse and Software Development in large and complex Healthcare organizations.

Maggie holds a Master of Science in Organizational Dynamics Degree from University of Pennsylvania.
results.name: Women In Tech Panel

results.description:
Meeting Agenda:

5:30 - 6:00 - Food / Socializing

6:00 - 6:15 - User Group Business

6:15 - 6:30 - Open Panel/Questions & Answers

6:30 - 7:00 - Warmup presentation

7:00 - 8:00 - Main presentation

30 minute session: There's a shortcut for that! - SSMS Tips and Tricks

Have you ever accidentally pressed the wrong combination of keys, stared at your screen in utter confusion, then spent the next ten minutes trying to figure out what you just pressed that did that really cool thing?


In this session, I will show you some of what I have learned and discovered that has made me say "Oh wow! Why did I not know this yesterday!?" - including SSMS interface tweaks, features and keyboard shortcuts.

Bio:Cathrine Wilhemsen loves teaching and sharing knowledge. She works as a consultant, technical architect and developer, focusing on Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence projects. Her core skills are ETL, SSIS, Biml and T-SQL development, but she enjoys everything from programming to data visualization. Outside of work she's active in the SQL Server and PASS communities as a Microsoft Data Platform MVP, BimlHero Certified Expert, speaker, blogger, organizer and chronic volunteer.

60 minute session: Revenge: The SQL!

Pop quiz DBA: Your developers are running rampant in production. Logic, reason, and threats have all failed. You're on the edge. What do you do? WHAT DO YOU DO?


Hint: You attend Revenge: The SQL!

This session will show you how to "correct" all those bad practices. Everyone logging in as sa? Running huge cursors? Using SELECT* and ad-hoc SQL? Stop them dead, without actually killing them. Ever dropped a table, or database, or WHERE clause? You can prevent that! And if you’re tired of folks ignoring your naming conventions, make them behave with Unicode…and take your revenge!

Revenge: The SQL! is fun and educational and may even have some practical use, but you’ll want to attend simply to indulge your Dark Side. Revenge: The SQL! assumes no liability and is not available in all 50 states. Do not taunt Revenge: The SQL! or Happy Fun Ball.--


Bio:Rob Volk is a SQL Server DBA in the Metro Atlanta area since 2001. An MCSE, he also moderates and answers the forums on SQLTeam.com. While an old-time cranky DBA, he no longer considers "business intelligence" an oxymoron or "the cloud" as merely atmospheric moisture, and is delightedly dipping his toes into both of these new oceans, and loves to do things in new and and unusual ways.
results.how_to_find_us: Auditorium in the Basement Enter by the Front Door.
results.name: Monthly Meeting

results.description:
We are proud to offer CPE credits for our Speaker Series of events.

Note: Event is capped at 60 attendees ('first come,' 'first serve')

Chris Roberts of Acalvio


From Chris - A LOT of changes recently…


A lot of opportunity to grow both inside an organization that has some phenomenal leadership as well as personally by being driven to excel in the R&D side of thing.

A Lot of introspective thoughts around the change from building companies (CCi5, Cyopsis, OWL and helping SG) to now working inside an organization and helping build them….I’m enjoying the change, not having to worry about everything and getting to focus on what I can to do proactively build Acalvio.

Talking at about 30 conferences this year, helping the National Guard and a host of other stuff…

And the good thing, with all the changes it opens up the opportunities to work with a number of folks again in the industry…that IS one part I am looking forward to.

THE AGENDA

Networking 6:00PM-6:30PM.
Speaker 6:30PM-7:30PM.
Questions 7:30PM-8:00PM

LOGISTICS
We have street parking available and provide plenty of tasty beverages.This meetup will take place at SecureSet Academy, the leader in Cybersecurity Bootcamp education.
results.name: Cybersecurity Expert Series - Chris Roberts, Acalvio

results.description:
The elevator will be locked after 6:00 PM. Call[masked] if you arrive after that time.

Succeeding as a Lean-Agile Organizational Change Agent: the Five Critical Domains of Expertise by Alex Yakyma


Despite the proliferation of Lean and Agile within the last two decades, most enterprises fail to embrace the new thinking and get stuck in the ritualistic formalism of basic practices. In his presentation Alex Yakyma will talk about the critical skills and strategies for organizational change agents, necessary to break from the gravity of the old organizational mentality and habits. As part of the discussion, he will highlight thefollowing topics:

• Learning to operate in a complex adaptive system

• Addressing the reductionist mindset and command-and- control culture

• Building sustainable organizational habits

• Growing organizational design in support of the flow

• Fostering organizational learning and adaptive economics

The talk will include a number of practical suggestions and adoption patterns that will provide good orientation to change leaders and enterprise coaches whose responsibility it is to drive sustainable improvement in their organizations.

WeWork Transportation Options:

• Union Station Transportation Center is across the street.

• $5 parking after 5pm in the 1550 Wewatta building's garage

• $5 parking after 5pm at Alpha Park[masked]th St. (between Wewatta and Chestnut)

• Metered street parking


About our speaker:

Alex Yakyma brings unique, extensive, and field-based experience to the topic of implementing Lean and Agile at scale. Alex is the founder of Org Mindset (http://orgmindset.com), a company whose mission is to help organizations grow the right mindset and evolve effective, context-specific implementation of Agile and Lean. Throughout his career he has served as an engineering and program manager in multi-cultural, highly distributed environments. As a methodologist, trainer and consultant, he has led numerous rollouts of Lean and Agile at scale, involving teams in North America, Europe and Asia, and has trained over a thousand coaches and change agents whose key role is to help their organizations achieve higher productivity and quality through the adoption of scalable, agile methods.
results.name: Succeeding as a Lean-Agile Organizational Change Agent (Alex Yakyma)

group.name: Denver Agile @ Scale – Enterprise Agile Meetup

results.description:
Hey Stackers! This event is gonna be a joint one with the Denver Node.js Meetup. The space is limited to 50. If y'all have any questions, reach out to your organizers.

---

Talk:


Building Real World Serverless Applications with Node, Webtask, and Vue


Serverless applications are all the rage these days, but can they be used to build real world applications? Find out as we build an app that allows you to compare two items and let's the community vote on which is best. In this talk we’ll cover building serverless applications with Node.js and Webtask. We are going to build, secure, and expose a Node.js API and hook it into a front-end client that we will build with Vue.js.


You will learn:


• Why serverless is awesome

• How to build an awesome front-end client with Vue.js

• How to add dynamic functionality by building a serverless Express.js app with Webtask

• The importance of security and how to implement JSON Web Token authentication and security for your users and API


(Bring your computer if you'd like to code along!)


---


Speakers:


Chris Sevilleja, Scotch.io

Chris is the founder of web dev tutorial site, scotch.io (http://scotch.io/). Taking complex topics and simplifying them to their core is his driving mission. He focuses on teaching web development topics and making real-world apps.

Ado Kukic, Auth0

Ado is a Developer Evangelist at Auth0. Mixing his passion of programming and education, he creates tutorials, courses, and other educational content focusing on security, authentication, and much more. On the front-end, he prefers Angular v2, while on the backend he flip-flops between Node.js and Golang.


---


Schedule:


6:30pm: Pizza, beer, networking

7:00pm: Talk

7:45pm: Questions
results.name: Building Real World Serverless Apps with Node, Webtask, and Vue

results.description:
About the Event:


This October, join us for a presentation and a fireside chat with Big Data Leaders from Ibotta, looker, and Qubole. Ibotta’s Data Team, the people who have helped shoppers earn 22M in rebates since 2012 will share their story of how they transformed into a data business to meet their B2B retail partner and customer demand by migrating from a traditional Data Warehouse model to a data lake analytics with Qubole running their pipelines and analytics.


Agenda

6:00 – 6:15 - Socialize over food and drinks

6:15 – 6:30 - Welcome, opening remarks and announcements

6:30 – 7:15 – Journey to building new Data Products and the business impact

7:15 – 8:00 – Fireside chat with Ibotta, Qubole, and Looker with Q&A

8:00-8:30 - Networking & Raffle

Presentations

Nathan Mclntyre - Big Data Engineer at Ibotta, will share how he and his teammates were faced with the challenges of their infrastructure limitations in Redshift due to rapidly increased demand from their retail customers and partners. He will explain the architecture of their new data products and technology tool set from Development to Data Science to Analytics. Mclntyre will discuss how they transitioned by first moving their storage endpoint to be able to apply these modern sets of technologies such as Kafka, Hive, Tez, Spark, and AirFlow for creating cutting-edge data pipelines.

Furthermore, he will explain how Qubole has allowed them to be more functional and automate these data operations to unlock the value of their data and efficiently leverage AWS infrastructure. Nathan Mclntyre will close the presentation explaining how this modern platform has allowed their Data users and products to scaling out to meet their growing demand, which has led to enabling the growth of Ibotta from a consumer app and to an enterprise analytics business.

The final 45 minutes will be a Fireside chat led by Andy Sautins discussing the platform further and how their role and outlook on the technology has been impacted, as well as perspectives from technology partners Looker and Qubole.

Hear from:

Ron White - VP of Engineering, Ibotta

Ben Roubicek - Sr.Solutions Architect, Qubole


Charley Frazier - Senior Analyst for Data Products, Ibotta

Nathan Mclntyre - Big Data Engineer, Ibotta

Lucas Thelosen- VP Professional Services, Looker

Heather Trujillo - Senior BI Analyst, Ibotta


About the Speakers

Nathan Mclntyre

Nathan McIntyre is a Data Engineer at Ibotta and lead architect of their Data Lake platform. He has spent the past 8 years building Big Data solutions for products, Engineers, and Data Scientists alike.Today McIntyre is leveraging technologies such as Kafka, AirFlow, Hive, Spark, and Presto using AWS infrastructure to scale Ibotta's data operations.

About Ibotta

As the largest consumer technology company headquartered in Denver, CO, Ibotta is transforming the shopping experience by making it easy for consumers to earn cashback on everyday purchases through a single smartphone app. The company partners with leading brands and retailers to offer rebates on groceries, electronics, clothing, gifts, home and office supplies, restaurant dining, and more. Ibotta is the premier destination for rewarded shopping on mobile, and has paid out more than $200 million in cash back to its users. Launched in 2012, Ibotta has nearly 22 million downloads, and is one of the most frequently used shopping apps in the United States. Smart shopping starts with Ibotta.

About Qubole

Qubole is a big data-as-a-service company that provides a fast, easy and reliable path to turn big data into valuable business insights. Qubole’s cloud-based platform addresses the challenges of processing huge volumes of structured and unstructured data. It runs on public clouds such as AWS, Azure, Oracle and Google Cloud Platform to help enterprises generate value from their big data while enabling their operations teams to be nimble and adaptive to their users’ needs.
results.name: Scaling Beyond a Data Warehouse to Meet Customer Demands

results.description:
Building products that people love is a challenging task. It’s something most of us in this group spend our careers trying to refine, improve and perfect. Now take that challenge and ensure product launches are successful as you add one, ten or 50 new Product Managers.


More and more leadership teams are investing in the growth and development of Product Management as the field itself grows and the value of it's role is better understood. Yet the ability to take one amazing product manager and develop a process and culture that sets up a larger Product Organization for success is a huge and daunting task.

Join Product Tank Denver on Thursday, October 19th, as we hear from a Product veteran who has successfully been able to do just that. Scott Williamson, VP of Product Management at SendGrid will share his advice and the tools that him and his team have developed to help SendGrid scale their Product organization during the past few years.

Whether you are facing these challenges today, have tackled them in the past, or ever anticipate that you will, don’t miss this night of drinks, networking and discussion!


Our Guest Presenter:

Scott Williamson
VP, Product Management at SendGrid

https://www.linkedin.com/in/scott-williamson/

Scott Williamson is VP, Product Management at SendGrid, where he helped scale the PM team from 4 people to 21 people over a 4 year period of rapid company growth. Scott is a 20-year software veteran, with over 8 years of experience managing large PM teams.
results.name: Insider Tips & Tools for Scaling a Product Team

results.description: Deep reinforcement learning is an area of research which has produced several exciting results in recent years, including learning to play video games, mastering the game of Go, and allowing robots to perform complex tasks using only vision as input. Deep Q Networks (DQN) are an intuitive and easy to implement approach to deep reinforcement learning. At this meeting, Dana will demonstrate how a DQN agent can learn to play a suite of Atari games, using only raw pixels and the score as input. Variations on the original DQN algorithm and current approaches (e.g., A3C) will also be shown, time permitting.
results.how_to_find_us: Get in to the building, on your left, take elevator to the basement, then walk right to the classroom 2.  Address: 1644 Platte St, Denver, CO 80202
results.name: Playing Atari with Deep Q Networks and Reinforcement Learning

group.name: Denver Deep Learning and Neural Networks Group

results.description:
NewTech Denver Intro - Aiko Cheslin (7:00 PM)

</a>Nuorikko - Kaitlyn Thomas (7:10 pm)

Nuorikko is a bridal brand targeting a modern, millennial consumer through updated silhouettes, modern tailoring, and minimalist, sophisticated styling. Some of our differentiation points include a mix-&-match line giving every bride the tools to make her own, customized look, and future technology platforms including a 3-D avatar to help the bride build & visualize her customized gown. Using a "mass customization" product model, we are made in the USA, based in Denver, CO, and targeting brides throughout the US.
